package.name: Math_Stats
package.description: Package to calculate statistical parameters of numerical arrays of data. The data can be in a simple numerical array, or in a cummulative numerical array. A cummulative array, has the value as the index and the number of repeats as the value for the array item, e.g. $data = array(3=>4, 2.3=>5, 1.25=>6, 0.5=>3). Nulls can be rejected, ignored or handled as zero values.

release.notes:
Many changes in the existing methods, and a number of new ones:
- Added better error handling. - Refactored existing methods to delegate calculations better - Added value caching for invariant statistical parameters - Added optional parameters to some existing methods to enhance their processing or output. Preserve the original behaviour as default so as not breack backwards compatibility - Added new methods: - center() - studentize() - range() - geometricMean() - harmonicMean() - product() - productN() - percentile() - quartiles() - quartileDeviation() - interquartileRange() - quartileVariationCoefficient() - Added a unit test class based on PEAR::PHPUnit

Added methods sampleCentralMoment() and sampleRawMoment() to calculate the corresponding nth moments of the data set.
Explicit casting of parameters passed to pow() to circumvent the warnings/errors given by some versions of the PHP interpreter. Thanks to Stephen Evans for pointing this problem out.
Fixed problem in element selection for the calculation of the median. Thanks to Jeff Hoover for finding this bug.
Fixed problem in element selection for the calculation of the median. Thanks to Jeff Hoover for finding this bug.
